name: Worldgate Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel on Priceline and got a price of $50 per night. We were there for the USSSA softball tournament at Disney's Wide World of Sports. The location to all of the Disney properties was excellent. Living in Florida and being a Disney annual passholder we have never stayed anywhere but on Disney property. That said I was very concerned when I read about this hotel on Trip Advisor. I called Priceline to see what my alternatives would be if the hotel turned out to be as bad as some have written and was only told to call customer service at Priceline with any problems. As others have reported the hotel is older (around 25 years) and is showing its wear. But I must say the customer service was very good and I found the hotel to be mostly clean and acceptable. I had emailed the hotel to request a king non-smoking room. Our room was 324 in the north wing of the hotel. Our room was clean and the carpet was fairly new. The furnitiure is dated but in good repair. The room had a refrigerator, coffee maker and a safe. All included in the price of the room. After we had been in the room for a few minutes the front desk called to make sure we were happy with our room. This hotel is being remodeled and sold as a time share condo. On checkout we found that due to slow season all rooms were being upgraded and we were not charged for the $10 extra per night for the king size sleep number bed. We were told on check in of the $5 per day resort charge. I truely feel for the price we got a great deal. Five nights for $310 how can you beat that. The hotel lobby and pool area are also acceptable. However I would skip the breakfast buffet.
reviews.title: Moderate hotel worth the price

likes.disliked: — Tile around pool could have been cleaner

reviews.text: Previously posted reviews scared me enough to contact Hotwire about whether or not this hotel should be considered a 3 star property. They assured me it was. We stayed 8/24-8/29. Upon arrival, we were sent to room 418. It was damp, cold and looked like it was last furnished in 1975. The air conditioning wasn't alleviating the humidity problem after the first night so I went down to the front desk and was immediately given a new room. The new room was better. It had been slighlty upgraded with sleep number beds, new linens and a new working air conditioner. The stay we had was satisfactory now that the room was dry, but the hotel was still a bit runned down. The side doors are opened all the time with no security locks. The whole place has a wet musty smell. I found out later that because it was slow season, we got upgraded to the "renovated" room without charge. It normally would have cost $10 per night to upgrade. The hotel also charges a "resort fee" for any rooms booked through a third party vendor such as Hotwire, as we did. It amounts to about $5 a day. Location was great if you're going to Disney, but I would not stay here again. I think this is a 2.5 star property at best. At least we didn't have any bedbugs.
reviews.title: Not my favorite

reviews.text: I booked this hotel based on the brand Radisson which generally has a good reputation.
reviews.title: Absolute Nightmare

reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel late in the evening with two children after a long flight.
reviews.title: Not bad for the money

reviews.text: We were shown to our room, which was supplied with a double bed, a cot and single bed for my 5 year old son.
reviews.title: nice but wet

reviews.text: Stayed here a few months ago to attend a conference and enjoyed my stay! The rooms were comfortable and the staff was very nice and helpful. Location wise you can't beat it for getting to Disney or area restaurants, didn't use the shuttle but the parks are 5 mins.away!
reviews.title: Coming Back Again

reviews.text: Restaurant was good, did the breakfast buffet and indulged in Room Service one night.
reviews.title: Had a Great Time

reviews.text: So we're going back again for fun filled weekend this time!
reviews.title: Not a place i would ever stay at again!!!

reviews.text: I recently attended a wedding held at the Radisson WorldGate Resort, and I was very impressed not only with the sleeping rooms, which were very spacious, clean and comfortable, but with the hotel staff overall. Everyone was very friendly, and most of the hotel employees walked through the foyer and the hallways with smiles on their faces, and they were not afraid to say ‘hello.’
reviews.title: Almost worth it

reviews.text: The ballroom where the reception was held was beautifully and elaborately decorated. I was told that one man does most of the decorations, and he is truly gifted. Accent lights were used to feature the cake table and the gift table, and the head table was festooned with a string of lights muted by lace fabric. The banquet staff was sharply dressed, and the service was impeccable. The overall quality of the food was outstanding, and when I ate in the restaurant, I was pleased to discover that my meal there was just as good, if not better, than my meal in the banquet hall.
reviews.title: are you kidding

likes.liked: — that it was clean and that there was different dining options on site
likes.disliked: — we actually had no problems or complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed 3 nights (10/3-10/6), and very much enjoyed our stay. The management & staff were very nice. We had room service for our breakfast one morning, the lady that brought it was nice as could be (Wendy?), the only thing that we didn't like, was the fact that while we were having our breakfast in bed, the maid came in & cleaned the room, I was trying to ask her to come back, but she didn't understand me, so I just let her do it. Otherwise our room was nice & clean, the restaurant & bar was nice, I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Nice Place

likes.liked: — That we got a smoking room

reviews.title: Stay Away
reviews.text: I spent 3 nights at this hotel. We chose to stay here because we brought a group on a charter bus and they had accommodations at a villa that did not allow charter bus parking. Our first night in Orlando we stayed at the Best Western Kissimmee Inn, which was great, but on the other side of Hwy 192 and we felt it was a bit too far from our group.

The room at the Radisson was a king room with sleep number bed. The carpet was filthy. The bathroom shower had mold and mildew everywhere. I had to go and buy a gallon of Clorox to clean the shower before we could use it. After cleaning four times, the shower did become clean - imagine that, all it needed was some cleaner. The furniture had a lot of water damage where I assume the air conditioner had somehow leaked water on it - it had rotted a lot of the wood. The room had a musty smell, hallways were extremely warm, and guests side entrances smelled of urine. We were in room 108.
reviews.title: Nice staff, bad everything else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and helpful but the property and accommodations were substandard. If this hotel had rates for 19.99 then I would say it's a great deal; anything above that and you need to make a reservation at the Best Western Kissimmee Inn (formerly Baymont suites).
reviews.title: Bang on the money! Location supurb!
Free Lizards With Each Room
reviews.text: We decided to stay at this resort based on the hotel's website, the pictures on said website, and its close proximity to the conference we were attending.

My hotel stay was 26OCT07 - 28OCT07 and was paid entirely through Priceline.com at $61.00 / night USD. I had driven from Hilton Head with a 2 nighter in Kissimmee and onwards back to Tampa/Clear water.
reviews.title: Tear it down!

likes.disliked: — The whole Radisson Maingate experience..... it should be torn down!

reviews.text: Upon Arrival or "what I should really say" as I was approaching the hotel in my rental car I knew I was about to check-in to a dump according to how the exterior of the hotel looked as well as the unkept grounds.
reviews.title: Horrific Stay!!!!! Please take the time to read this!!!!!

reviews.text: The personnel at the front desk were dressed professionally and that's where the professionalism ended. My assigned room was on the 6th floor. Upon entering the room I would have to say the decor and furniture were at least 20yrs old. I found the room to be filthy and the mattress showed it age with protruding springs.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: Within minutes I returned to the front desk and inuired about changing my room. The personnel at the front desk were apologetic and I was moved to the first floor with a king sleep number bed at no extra cost. My new room was just as dated as the first. The only new item in the room was the king size sleep number bed.... which I found to be uncomfortable..... so much for the Lindsey Wagner info-mmercials.
reviews.title: Close to the parks, worn around the edges

likes.liked: — Close to parks, easy parking and room access
likes.disliked: — Worn out and shabby feel, much of hotel being converted to timeshare rooms.

reviews.text: Unfortunately my stay was through Priceline and there was no way of getting out of that contract with a refund. I was embarrassed to stay there and I felt bad for many Brits that I had seen in passing at the hotel. Trust me on this one..... this hotel in no way represents the other Kissimmee or Orlando International Drive hotels. I have stayed in better and more updated hotels for less money in the Orlando area.
reviews.title: Horrible! Beware!

description: Welcome to Worldgate Resort Hotel & Conference Center.We are located just 1 mile from Walt Disney World Resort.Offering a Complimentary shuttle service to Walt Disney World's Animal Kingdom, Epcot Center, Universal Studios,and Sea World, on a daily basis.With over 30,000 square feet of flexible event space, and a 12,200 square feet Ballroom that seats 1,000 people in a Corporate classroom setting. Space enough to accomodatee up to 1,300 in a Banquet Event.Our two pool areas feature over 3,500 square feet of pool deck, 2 Pools, a 10 person Jacuzzi, and a Poolside Bar and Restaurant. For the Children, we have a video game arcade, with an air hockey, and ping pong table. Three Gaming stations including "Guitar Hero.We also have a ground floor Children's theatre and gaming station.Need to rent a car while in the area? An on site Avis Car rental desk is located in our lobby. We have a professional staff at our "Tour desk" Happy to assist you with area attraction information and theme Park Tickets. We look forward to having you here, and hope that you are comfortable and happy at the WorldGate Resort Hotel & Convention Center.
